title: Israel is accused by the world too easily during the war - editorial
message:
A targeted IDF strike was carried out in Rafah on Sunday, targeting two Hamas leaders, which seemingly led to an explosion that killed 45 civilians.
Both Rabia and Nagar were in a compound a mile away from the humanitarian zone that was created to keep Palestinians safe when Israel targeted the terrorists in a precise airstrike.
But one thing is clear from even the shortest of closer looks into what happened on Sunday: Israel did not intentionally kill dozens of Palestinian civilians.
The IDF – Israel as a whole, in fact – knows to own up to its mistakes and to reach conclusions that would change future actions accordingly.
However, the world media and critics of Israel afford it even less credibility than they do a terrorist organization.
event_breakdown: IDF strike targeted two Hamas leaders in Rafah.

title: Relatives console a man who lost his apartment and maybe his family in Russian strike on Kharkiv
message:
Relatives console 63-year-old Vyacheslav Vlasenko near the entrance to his high-rise apartment in Kharkiv that was destroyed by a Russian missile overnight on May 31, Suspilne reported on Telegram.
The man lived with his family in an apartment on the third floor, which was completely destroyed in the explosion.
Missile attacks on Kharkiv on May 31Read also: Russian airstrikes target Kharkiv with ‘carousel’ bombing tacticA series of explosions rang out in Kharkiv overnight on May 31.
A densely built-up area had been hit, Kharkiv Mayor Ihor Terekhov, reported.
The missile hit an apartment building and there may still be people under the rubble, Kharkiv Oblast Military Administration reported later.

Krasnodar regional Veniamin Kondratyev said: “As a result of the air strike, the infrastructure of the oil depot was damaged.

title: Paramedic killed , another wounded in Israeli airstrike on Lebanon
message:
Beirut, June 1 : A paramedic from Hezbollah's Islamic Health Authority was killed, and another was wounded in an Israeli airstrike targeting an ambulance in the western sector of southern Lebanon, a Lebanese military source said.
Civil defence teams worked to extinguish the fire and transported the body of the victim and the injured individual to a hospital in Tyre, the source said.
Meanwhile, Hezbollah said on Friday that it had launched a combat drone attack on Israeli artillery units in al-Zaoura bunkers, causing damages.
Tensions along the Lebanon-Israel border escalated on October 8, 2023, following a barrage of rockets launched by Hezbollah towards Israel in solidarity with Hamas's attack on Israel on October 7.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.

title: Slovak PM Fico released from hospital after shooting – DW – 05 / 31 / 2024
message:
Robert Fico was shot with four bullets in an assassination attempt in mid-May.
Slovakian media has reported that the prime minister was flown out of the hospital to continue recovery at his home in Bratislava.
After an assassination attempt put Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico in hospital for over two weeks, the 59-year-old politician is now continuing his recovery at home.
A 71-year-old gunman shot Fico with four bullets at close range on May 15.
The shooting of Fico is the first assassination attempt targeting a European leader since 2003, when Serbian Prime Minister Zoran Djindjic was shot and killed in Belgrade.
event_breakdown:
Target Event:
Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico was shot in the arm, chest, abdomen and leg in a shooting outside of a restaurant in the nation's capital on Thursday. The 59-year-old PM is still in intensive care.

title: Kim Jong Un oversees missile launch in  power demonstration  to South Korea
message:
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw a firing drill of 600mm super-large multiple rocket launchers in a "power demonstration" to South Korea, state-run media reported Friday.
South Korea's military said Thursday it detected a launch of around 10 short-range ballistic missiles from the Pyongyang area.
The United States and South Korea refer to the 600mm rocket system as the KN-25 and characterize it as a short-range ballistic missile.
North Korea has claimed since October 2022 that the weapon can be fitted with a tactical nuclear warhead.
"Kim Jong Un is absolutely not interested [in talks]," Sue Mi Terry, a senior fellow with the Council on Foreign Relations, said.
event_breakdown: North Korea fired 10 short-range ballistic missiles toward the East Sea on Thursday. Kim Jong Un oversaw the firing drill of 600mm super-large multiple rocket launchers on Friday.

title: North Korea says Kim Jong Un supervised simulated attacks on South Korea
message:
SEOUL, South Korea -North Korean leader Kim Jong Un supervised drills involving the firing of nuclear-capable multiple rocket launchers to show the country’s ability to carry out a preemptive attack on rival South Korea, state media reported Friday.
North Korea has simulated nuclear strikes on South Korea numerous times, but the latest drills came after animosities on the Korean Peninsula rose over North Korea's recent failed spy satellite launch.
'Absurd, irrational provocations'Also this week, North Korea flew hundreds of huge balloons into South Korea carrying manure and other trash, and allegedly jammed GPS navigation signals in the South.
Ministry spokesperson Kim Inae said separately that South Korea “strongly condemns” North Korea for threatening preemptive strikes against the South.
The North Korean firing exercises appeared to be short-range ballistic missile test-launches that South Korea detected from North Korea's capital region on Thursday.

title: Israel Intercepts Cruise Missile Launched From Iraq
message:
Time of Israel is describing "cruise missiles" fired from Iraq and shot down over northern Israel on Thursday.
Other Israeli outlets pointed to a single cruise missile inbound over Israel and possibly accompanied by drones, however.
"Following the interceptions, the pro-Iranian militias in Iraq claimed to have launched drones towards Eilat," Israel National News (Arutz Sheva) reported.
"Earlier today, following sirens regarding a hostile aircraft infiltration in the Golan Heights area, the IDF intercepted a cruise missile that approached Israel from the east," the IDF said.
Wednesday saw an Israeli airstrike hit deep inside Syria, in Baniyas city, though it's unclear what the precise target was.

Israel National News (Arutz Sheva) reports that a cruise missile allegedly headed toward Israel in the east was shot down today, and the pro-Iranian militia in Iraq reportedly claims to have launched drones toward Eilat.

title: Knife - wielding attacker at anti - Islam event shot at by German police
message:
Mannheim : , May 31 (IANS/DPA) A knife-wielding attacker in the German city of Mannheim on Friday targeted a gathering of the anti-Islam right-wing group Pax Europa, according to members of the group.

title: Man sought in Dania Beach gas station random stabbing
message:
MIAMI - The Broward Sheriff's Office is searching for a man they say randomly stabbed another man at a Dania Beach gas station.
Authorities say the unprovoked attack occurred Sunday, May 19, just before midnight at a gas station near the 1200 block of South Federal Highway.
Investigators said surveillance video shows the victim at a gas station standing next to the passenger side of a white truck.
Once in the pump station area, the individual walks toward the victim makes a sharp left, and then stabs the victim without warning before fleeing on foot."
Anyone with information on this case is asked to contact BSO at 954-321-4384 or Broward Crime Stoppers at 954-493-TIPS (8477).

title: Slovakia Robert Fico is released from hospital
message:
BRATISLAVA, Slovakia (AP) — Slovakia’s populist prime minister, Robert Fico, has been released from a hospital where he was treated after an assassination attempt.
Miriam Lapunikova, the director of the hospital in the central city of Banska Bystrica, said on Friday that Fico was transported to his home, where he continues to recover from the attack.
Fico immediately underwent a five-hour surgery to treat multiple wounds he suffered in the shooting, followed by another two-hour surgery two days later to remove dead tissue from his gunshot wounds.
The country’s Specialized Criminal Court in the town of Pezinok ordered the suspect, who is charged with attempted murder, to remain behind bars.
Prosecutors told police not to publicly identify the suspect or release details about the case.
event_breakdown: Slovakia: Populist prime minister Fico released from hospital after assassination attempt

Miriam Lapunikova, the director of the clinic in the central city of Banska Bystrica, said on Friday that Mr Fico was taken to his home, where he continues to recover from the attack.
Ms Lapunikova thanked Mr Fico in a statement for being “a disciplined patient”.
Mr Fico was shot in the stomach as he greeted supporters on May 15 in the town of Handlova, about 85 miles north east of the capital, Bratislava.

title: Germany : Knife attack in Mannheim , suspect shot
message:
A police officer was reportedly among those injured during a stabbing attack in the German city of Mannheim on Friday around midday.
The attack reportedly took place during a right-wing demonstration on one of Mannheim's central squares.
Mannheim Mayor Christian Sprecht said he was "speechless" after the attack.
The right-leaning mayor urged the people not to speculate about the motives behind the attack before investigators publish their findings.
Commenting on the attack in Mannheim, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said his thoughts were with the victims of the stabbing rampage.

title: North Korea Kim supervises firing drills simulating preemptive attacks on South Korea
message:
North Korea says leader Kim Jong Un supervised drills involving the firing of nuclear-capable multiple rocket launchers to show the country’s ability to carry out a preemptive attack on rival South KoreaSEOUL, South Korea -- North Korean leader Kim Jong Un supervised drills involving the firing of nuclear-capable multiple rocket launchers to show the country’s ability to carry out a preemptive attack on rival South Korea, state media reported Friday.
North Korea has simulated nuclear strikes on South Korea numerous times, but the latest drills came after animosities on the Korean Peninsula rose over North Korea's recent failed spy satellite launch.
Also this week, North Korea flew hundreds of huge balloons into South Korea carrying manure and other trash, and allegedly jammed GPS navigation signals in the South.
Ministry spokesperson Kim Inae said separately that South Korea “strongly condemns” North Korea for threatening preemptive strikes against the South.
The North Korean firing exercises appeared to be short-range ballistic missile test-launches that South Korea detected from North Korea's capital region on Thursday.

title: Ukraine Security Service and Armed Forces conduct several - day operation of destroying Russian supply routes to Crimea
message:
The Defence Forces of Ukraine, jointly with the Security Service of Ukraine (SSU), have conducted a several-days long operation of destroying the supply routes for the Russian troops in temporarily occupied Crimea.
At first, the Defence Forces launched a missile attack on two ferries that headed to the Kavkaz port and were used for the purpose of military logistics of the Russians.
On 30-31 May at night, the SSU, jointly with the Ukrainian Navy, launched a strike on a transfer tank farm in the Kavkaz sea port.
Photo: TelegramBackground:The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine said that the Ukrainian Defence Forces successfully hit the Kerch ferry crossing with ATACMS missiles on the night of 29-30 May.
The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine also confirmed that Neptune missiles hit a ferry crossing and an oil terminal at Port Kavkaz in Russia's Krasnodar Krai on the night of 30-31 May.

title: Hezbollah launches suicide drones and Burkan rockets at Israeli posts
message:
On Friday, Hezbollah launched an aerial attack using suicide drones targeting Iron Dome launchpads in al-Za’oura, located in the occupied Golan Heights.
This action was a retaliation for Israeli airstrikes on the southern Lebanese border town of Houla.
Additionally, Hezbollah fired “heavy-caliber Burkan rockets” at Israeli positions in northern Israel.
In response, Israeli artillery shelled the southern Lebanese border town of al-Wazzani.
The group also claimed responsibility for a Thursday night attack on Ramot Naftali in northern Israel, in response to Israeli strikes on southern Lebanese villages.

title: Israel could have used smaller weapons against Hamas to avoid deaths in Gaza tent fire , experts say
message:
Israel could have used smaller weapons against Hamas to avoid deaths in Gaza tent fire, experts sayWASHINGTON (AP) — Defense experts who have reviewed debris images from an Israeli airstrike that ignited a deadly fire in a camp for displaced Palestinians questioned why Israel did not use smaller, more precise weapons when so many civilians were nearby.
They said the bombs used were likely U.S.-made.
Based on those images and satellite photos of the debris field, two defense experts said the bombs used were likely U.S.-made 250-pound (113-kilogram) GBU-39 small-diameter bombs.
Though they're smaller than many other weapons the U.S. has provided to Israel, these bombs can still create a wide swath of damage.
The defense experts said Israel had better options to turn to than the GBU-39 when civilians were nearby.
event_breakdown: Israel - Israeli airstrike ignited a deadly fire in a camp for displaced Palestinians, defense experts said Israel could have used smaller, more precise weapons when so many civilians were nearby.

title: Knifeman stabs multiple people on YouTube livestream at political rally
message:
The moment of the attack in the city of Mannheim, GermanyThis is the harrowing moment a knifeman went on a stabbing rampage during a rally in Germany today.
At least two people were stabbed – including a police officer – during the political event in Mannheim, which was live-streamed on YouTube.
Prominent anti-Islamist campaigner Michael Stürzenberger was due to speak at the rally at the market square.
In the video, the suspect is seen stabbing him with force several times in his upper body and head.
A statement from police said: ‘There is currently a major police operation on the market square in Mannheim.

title: Yemen Houthis say 16 killed as U . S . drops massive bunker - buster bomb
message:
Hodeida, Yemen — Yemen's Iran-backed Houthis on Friday threatened to escalate attacks on Red Sea shipping after overnight strikes by the United States and Britain that the rebels said killed 16 people.
The GBU-72 bomb was dropped by a U.S. Air Force jet in an effort to destroy an underground Houthi facility.
The Houthis, who control much of Yemen, said 16 people were killed and 40 more wounded, including an unspecified number of civilians, but there was no independent confirmation of those numbers.
The British defense ministry said its warplanes launched strikes in "a joint operation with U.S. forces against Houthi military facilities."
In February, the Houthis held a mass funeral in Sanaa for 17 fighters they said were killed in U.S. and British strikes.
event_breakdown: Hodeida, Yemen - A U.S. airstrike on a Houthi target in Yemen has killed 20 people, the Houthis said, a likely sign the Saudi-led coalition's attack will push the rebels to escalate attacks on Red Sea shipping.

title: North Korea Kim supervises firing drills simulating preemptive attacks on South Korea – Winnipeg Free Press
message:
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korean leader Kim Jong Un supervised drills involving the firing of nuclear-capable multiple rocket launchers to show the country’s ability to carry out a preemptive attack on rival South Korea, state media reported Friday.
Also this week, North Korea flew hundreds of huge balloons into South Korea carrying manure and other trash, and allegedly jammed GPS navigation signals in the South.
Ministry spokesperson Kim Inae said separately that South Korea “strongly condemns” North Korea for threatening preemptive strikes against the South.
In this undated photo provided on Friday, May 31, 2024 by the North Korean government, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un supervises firing drills at an undisclosed place in North Korea.
The North Korean firing exercises appeared to be short-range ballistic missile test-launches that South Korea detected from North Korea’s capital region on Thursday.
location: Based on the text, it appears that the main focus of event is in Pyongyang, North Korea.

title: Houthi rebels launch missile attack against USS Eisenhower
message:
U.S. defense officials have said they are not aware of any attacks on USS Eisenhower after Yemen's Houthi rebels claimed to have launched a barrage of missiles at the aircraft carrier in the Red Sea.
Winged and ballistic missiles were used in the attack on the US warship, the military spokesperson said without providing evidence, adding that 'the hits were accurate and direct'.
The U.S. and British militaries said they launched strikes against Houthi targets in Yemen on Thursday to deter the militant group from further disrupting shipping in the Red Sea.
The Houthis in recent months have stepped up attacks on shipping in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden , demanding that Israel end the war in Gaza, which has killed more than 36,000 Palestinians.
The war began after Hamas-led militants attacked Israel on October 7, killing about 1,200 people and taking 250 hostage.

title: Ukrainian air defense downs four Shahed drones , Iskander - K cruise missile
message:
Ukraine's air defense units intercepted four Russian Shahed attack drones and an Iskander-K cruise missile on Friday, May 31.
Ukrainian Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk reported this on the Telegram messaging app, according to Ukrinform.
On the night of May 30 to 31, the Russian army attacked Kharkiv with five S-300/S-400 air defense missiles fired from the Belgorod region and Kyiv with an Iskander-K cruise missile launched from the Kursk region.
The enemy also launched four Shahed-131/136 type attack UAVs from the Yeysk area.
As a result of the combat work, anti-aircraft missile units and mobile fire groups destroyed four Shahed drones in the Kyiv, Zaporizhzhia, and Dnipropetrovsk regions, as well as an Iskander-K missile in the Kyiv region.

title: Day 237 : Intensified Israeli Bombing Kills Dozens In Gaza
message:
On Thursday, Day 237 of the ongoing genocide in Gaza, the Israeli army intensified the bombing and shelling of various parts of the coastal enclave, killing and wounding dozens of Palestinians.
The Israeli army said one soldier was killed in northern Gaza and added that three soldiers were injured.
Media sources said the army fired many artillery shells at homes and buildings in northern Gaza, including Beit Lahia and Jabalia, entire residential blocks, and even centers and tents used by displaced families.
At least two Palestinians were killed, and many were injured, when the army fired a missile at displaced families near the Tuwam junction, in northern Gaza.
Medical sources said at least nineteen Palestinians were killed, and dozens injured, in repeated bombings and shelling of various parts of Rafah, Thursday.

Israeli soldiers injure three soldiers, one Palestinian killed in Gaza
Israeli forces fired artillery shells at houses in northern Gaza on Thursday, killing two Palestinians and wounding dozens.
At least nineteen Palestinians were killed and dozens injured in repeated bombings and shelling in Rafah, Thursday. The Israeli military also fired a missile at displaced families near the Tuwam junction in northern Gaza. One Israeli soldier was killed and three soldiers were injured.

ST. JOSEPH COUNTY, Ind.
(WNDU) - An Osceola man is facing numerous charges, including attempted murder, after police say he stabbed another man and a dog after he smoked meth earlier this week.
Officers were called around 10 p.m. on Monday to 10000 block of Douglas Road in eastern St. Joseph County.
Keith Ball (St. Joseph County Jail)The stabbing victim later told officers that he and Ball had been sitting in the living room smoking methamphetamine just prior to Ball stabbing him.
He is currently being held at the St. Joseph County Jail.

title: Israel confirms forces in central Rafah as offensive expands in southern Gaza city - World News
message:
Southern Gaza has been turned into a 'hell on earth' as bombs rain down on the beleaguered residents of Rafah with one million already fleeing from the terrible conditionsThe Israeli military has confirmed that its forces are operating in central parts of Rafah in its expanding offensive in the southern Gaza city.
The military said in a statement Friday that its troops in central Rafah had uncovered Hamas rocket launchers and tunnels and dismantled a weapons storage city of the group.
This comes after a devastating strike on Sunday near a Rafah refugee camp caused a fire with reportedly 45 people dying including women and children.
At least a dozen people were killed in two airstrikes Friday in central Gaza.
More than one million Palestinians have fled the city since the assault began, scattering around southern and central Gaza.

title: Man Stabbed With A Machete In Times Square
message:
Authorities in New York City have detained three men allegedly involved in a brutal machete attack in Times Square on Thursday (May 30) morning.
Officials said that a man was stabbed in the legs outside of a McDonald's just after 10 a.m.
The victim was rushed to the hospital in stable condition and is expected to survive.
Investigators told WABC that they believe that the stabbing was the result of a turf dispute between people selling items in the popular tourist destination.
Officials said that the investigation remains ongoing and have asked anybody with information about the machete attack to contact Crime Stoppers by calling 1-800-577-TIPS.

Authorities in New York City have detained three men allegedly involved in a brutal machete attack in Times Square on Thursday (May 30) morning.
Officials said that a man was stabbed in the legs outside of a McDonald's just after 10 a.m.
The victim was rushed to the hospital in stable condition and is expected to survive.
Investigators told WABC that they believe that the stabbing was the result of a turf dispute between people selling items in the popular tourist destination.
Officials said that the investigation remains ongoing and have asked anybody with information about the machete attack to contact Crime Stoppers by calling 1-800-577-TIPS.
event_breakdown: NYC machete attack in Times Square - Man stabbed in legs outside of McDonald's in Times Square on Thursday (May 30) morning. Victim taken to hospital in stable condition. Attack believed to be result of a turf dispute between people selling items in popular tourist destination. Investigation ongoing.

title: 16 killed during U . S .- British airstrikes on Yemen Hodeidah : Houthi TV - Xinhua
message:
SANAA, May 31 (Xinhua) -- The Houthi-controlled al-Masirah TV reported on Friday that at least 16 people were killed and 35 others injured in airstrikes launched by a U.S.-British coalition on the Red Sea port city of Hodeidah on Thursday evening.
Hodeidah health authorities attributed the casualties to strikes on the Hodeidah Radio building and the Salif port, according to al-Masirah.
This follows a previous report by the channel, claiming U.S. and British warplanes targeted Houthi-held Sanaa, Hodeidah, and Taiz province on Thursday.
Meanwhile, the U.S. Central Command said on Friday morning that U.S. forces shot down eight Houthi drones on Thursday, followed by a British airstrike on 13 Houthi facilities "in self-defense."
On Wednesday, the Houthi group claimed attacks on six cargo ships in the Red Sea, Arabian Sea, and the Mediterranean that had called on Israeli ports.

title: Germany : Knife attack in Mannheim , suspect shot – DW – 05 / 31 / 2024
message:
Several people, including a police officer, were stabbed after a knife-wielding assailant reportedly attacked a right-wing protest in Germany's Mannheim.
A police officer was reportedly among those injured during a stabbing attack in the German city of Mannheim on Friday around midday.
However, local newspaper Mannheimer Morgen cited a police spokesman as saying that one of the officers on the scene sustained severe injuries.
The right-leaning mayor urged the people not to speculate about the motives behind the attack before investigators publish their findings.
Chancellor Scholz says attacker should be punished 'severely'Commenting on the attack in Mannheim, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said his thoughts were with the victims of the stabbing rampage.
event_breakdown: Mannheim stabbing attack

title: Deadly strikes on Kharkiv as Biden lets Ukraine use US arms inside Russia
message:
A firefighter sprays water in a Kharkiv hardware store destroyed by a Russian strike earlier in the week.
But that calculus appears to have changed since Russian forces launched a fresh offensive in the Kharkiv region this month.
Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-largest city, is located just across the border from Russia’s Belgorod and regularly comes under attack from Russian missiles.
Russian strikes that hit a hardware superstore in the city last weekend killed 16 people.
German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, however, remained less sure, saying Ukraine should act within the law — and Berlin had not supplied weapons that could hit Russia anyway.

title: Russian missile attack on Kyiv damages power facility , grid , energy company says
message:
Russian missile attack on Kyiv damages power facility, grid, energy company saysreuters_tickers2 minutesKYIV (Reuters) -A Russian missile attack on Kyiv destroyed a power facility and damaged the power grid in Holosiivskyi district of the Ukrainian capital on Friday, the DTEK energy company said.
Ukraine’s Air Force said on the Telegram messaging app that Russia attacked Kyiv with an Iskander short-range ballistic missile and drones.
Russia has been stepping up air strikes and ground attacks on Ukraine as it seeks to capture more territory in the country’s east and northeast, but the overnight air attack was not as intense as some previous onslaughts.
Ukraine’s largest private energy company said power had been restored to most of the buildings affected by the attack with back-up sources, leaving some 10 private residences and one business without power.
There were no injuries, according to preliminary information, but missile debris fell down and damaged the facility and the grid.

title: Ukraine takes out Iskander cruise missile and all 9 other aerial targets in Russia May 31 overnight attack
message:
Ukraine takes out Iskander cruise missile and all 9 other aerial targets in Russia's May 31 overnight attackUkraine managed to shoot down all six missiles, including an Iskander cruise missile, and all four drones in Russia's overnight attack on May 31, Air Force commander Mykola Oleshchuk reported.
Ukraine's Air Force managed to neutralize all five S-300/S-400 anti-aircraft guided missiles, one Iskander-K cruise missile, and four Shahed-131/136 type kamikaze drones in the combined attack.
The Russians launched S-300/S-400 guided missiles against Kharkiv from Russia’s Belgorod Oblast,The Iskander-K missile was launched at Kyiv from Russia's Kursk Oblast.
Shahed drones were launched from near Yeysk, Russia.
Most of the casualties came after a five-story apartment was partially destroyed (from the 3rd to 5th floors).
event_breakdown: Russia launched an S-300/S-400 guided missile against Kharkiv, an Iskander-K cruise missile against Kyiv, and Shahed-131/136 type kamikaze drones from near Yeysk.

title: 30 years after deadly bombing , Buenos Aire AMIA Jewish center unveils colorful redesign
message:
BUENOS AIRES — The AMIA Jewish community center in this city has unveiled a colorful new facade, three decades after a deadly bombing turned it into a symbol of destruction.
The new facade is composed of colored triangles making up a patchwork pattern that wraps around multiple sides of AMIA’s eight-story building in the Once neighborhood.
The design is meant to represent AMIA’s spirit and diverse activities, its director, Daniel Pomerantz, said Friday at a dedication ceremony.
“We are now living two important dates — the 30 years since the bombing and 130 of life.
Four years after the attack, Israeli artist Yaacov Agam unveiled a colorful sculpture in the courtyard of the rebuilt community center that symbolizes both the bombing and AMIA’s values.
event_breakdown: Map highlighting the location of Buenos Aires, Argentina where the AMIA Jewish community center has been unveiled a colorful new facade, three decades after a deadly bombing turned it into a symbol of destruction.

title: Slovak prime minister who was shot in assassination attempt is released from the hospital
message:
Slovakia’s populist prime minister, Robert Fico, has been released from a hospital where he was treated after an assassination attemptSlovak prime minister who was shot in an assassination attempt is released from the hospitalBRATISLAVA, Slovakia -- Slovakia’s populist prime minister, Robert Fico, has been released from a hospital where he was treated after an assassination attempt.
Miriam Lapunikova, the director of the hospital in the central city of Banska Bystrica, said on Friday that Fico was transported to his home, where he continues to recover from the attack.
Fico lives in the capital, Bratislava.
The country’s Specialized Criminal Court in the town of Pezinok ordered the suspect, who is charged with attempted murder, to remain behind bars.
Prosecutors told police not to publicly identify the suspect or release details about the case.
event_breakdown: Slovakia's populist prime minister, Robert Fico, has been released from a hospital where he was treated after an assassination attempt. He was taken to his home, where he continues to recover from the attack.

title: Yemen Houthis say they launched missile attack on US aircraft carrier Eisenhower in Red Sea
message:
NEW DELHI: Yemen 's Houthi rebels launched a missile attack on the US aircraft carrier Eisenhower in the Red Sea , Houthi military spokesperson Yahya Saree said on Friday.
The strike comes in response to recent US and British airstrikes on Yemeni soil.According to Saree, six US and British strikes have resulted in casualties, with 16 people killed and 41 wounded, including civilians.
Iranian foreign ministry spokesperson Nasser Kanaani held the US and British governments responsible for the consequences of what he termed "crimes against the Yemeni people.
"The Houthi rebels, who control Yemen's capital and major urban centers, have been engaged in a series of attacks on international shipping in the Red Sea since November, purportedly in solidarity with the Palestinians amid the conflict between Israel and Hamas.
These attacks have triggered retaliatory airstrikes by the US and Britain since February, exacerbating the volatile situation in the region.
event_breakdown: Target event not found

title: Slovak PM Robert Fico released from hospital after assassination attempt
message:
Slovakia’s populist prime minister Robert Fico has been released from hospital where he was treated after an assassination attempt.
Miriam Lapunikova, the director of the clinic in the central city of Banska Bystrica, said on Friday that Mr Fico was taken to his home, where he continues to recover from the attack.
AdvertisementMs Lapunikova thanked Mr Fico in a statement for being “a disciplined patient”.
Mr Fico was shot in the stomach as he greeted supporters on May 15 in the town of Handlova, about 85 miles north east of the capital, Bratislava.
Mr Fico’s government has made efforts to overhaul public broadcasting — a move critics said would give the government full control of public television and radio.
event_breakdown: Slovakia's Populist PM Robert Fico Released from Hospital after Assassination Attempt

title: Stabbing in Germany : Several people hurt in knife attack in Mannheim
message:
Far-right activist among several injuredNEW DELHI: Several people were hurt in a stabbing attack in the German city of Mannheim on Friday, the police said.
A man wielding a knife attacked and wounded multiple people in a square.
Police shot at the attacker, who also was hurt, as per reports by AP.The attack occurred shortly after 11:30 am (local time) on the Marktplatz, a bustling square in Mannheim's downtown area.
Details regarding the severity of injuries sustained by the victims and the assailant remain scarce, as authorities have yet to provide specific information.Chancellor Olaf Scholz decried the "terrible" incident.
"My thoughts are with the victims," Scholz wrote on X, formerly Twitter.
event_breakdown:
Man With Knife Attacks Several People in Germany

* A knife-wielding man attacked and wounded multiple people in a square in the German city of Mannheim on Friday.
* Police officers fired at the attacker, who was himself injured, according to a report by the Associated Press (AP).
* The incident occurred at 11:30 AM local time (local time) on the Marktplatz, a square in Mannheim's downtown area.
* According to Chancellor Olaf Scholz, the injuries were "terrible." Authorities did not release specific details about the incident, such as the severity of the injuries.

title: Kano mosque bombing death toll hits 21
message:
Four more victims of the May 15 bombing of a mosque at Gadan village, Gezawa Local Government Area of Kano State, died on Thursday, increasing the death toll to 21.
Twenty-five early-morning worshippers were injured in the mosque bombing attack, one person died on the day of the incident and 20 others have died at the Muhammed Specialists Hospital, Kano, where they had been receiving treatment, leaving only four surviving.
A 38-year-old man, Shafiú Abubakar, attacked the mosque with a locally-fabricated bomb on May 15.
Governor Abba Yusuf of Kano State had ordered the prosecution of the bombing mastermind before the Shariah Court, vowing that he would not hesitate to sign the death warrant if the suspect is convicted and sentenced to death.
He added that some of those who cheated him were in the mosque at the time of his attack.
event_breakdown: May 15 mosque bombing of Gadan village in Gezawa Local Government Area of Kano State, Nigeria

title: Orban : NATO Fighting Fire with Flamethrower in Ukraine - Novinite . com
message:
Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán stated today that NATO's increasing involvement in the Ukraine-Russia conflict is akin to a firefighter attempting to extinguish a blaze with a fire flamethrower, Reuters reported.
Orbán remarked on Hungarian state radio that NATO is inching closer to war with each passing week.
His comments come in the context of today's meeting in Prague, where the alliance's foreign ministers are discussing military aid to Ukraine.
The Ukrainian military claimed in a Telegram post that Russia's advanced air defense systems failed to intercept the missiles and drones, resulting in damage to critical logistical and supply infrastructure for the Russian military.
In related news, a Russian missile attack last night damaged Kyiv's power grid, destroying a power facility, according to Ukraine's largest private electricity company, DTEK, on Telegram.
location:
)
The main event takes place in Prague, Czech Republic.

title: Ukrainian Missile and Drone Strikes Ignite Russian Oil Facilities
message:
Two people were injured in a Ukrainian missile and drone strike on oil facilities in Russia's southern Krasnodar region, Russian officials said on Friday.
The Russian defence ministry said on the Telegram app that its air defence systems had destroyed five missiles and 29 drones which Ukraine had launched early on Friday.
The Ukrainian military said missiles fired by the Ukrainian navy had struck an oil terminal at the Russian port of Kavkaz in the Krasnodar region and that drones had struck another oil depot in the same region.
Separately, the Russian defence ministry said its forces had downed single drones over the Voronezh, Belgorod and Tambov regions overnight.
It said Russian air defence systems had also destroyed a Ukrainian drone over the Volga river region of Tatarstan, which hosts a number of industrial enterprises as well as oil producing and refining facilities.
event_breakdown:
Target Event:
Ukrainian missiles and drones have struck oil facilities in Russia's southern Krasnodar region, Russian officials said on Friday.

title: Israeli troops are in central Rafah , IDF confirms
message:
CNN —The Israeli military is in central Rafah, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed in a statement Friday, despite international concern and anger over its military operation in Gaza’s southernmost city.
The IDF statement confirms what eyewitnesses told CNN earlier this week, when tanks were spotted in central Rafah for the first time since it entered the city earlier this month.
“IDF troops in central Rafah located Hamas rocket launchers, terror tunnel shafts, and weapons.
The troops also dismantled a Hamas weapons storage facility in the area,” the IDF said in the statement.
On Wednesday, the Israeli military said it had established “operational control” over the Philadelphi Corridor, a 14-kilometer (8.7-mile) buffer zone on the Palestinian side of the Egypt-Gaza border.
event_breakdown: IDF Troops in Central Rafah (source: CNN)

title: Two injured in Ukrainian attack on oil depot in Russia Krasnodar , officials say
message:
Two injured in Ukrainian attack on oil depot in Russia’s Krasnodar, officials say2 minutes(Reuters) -Two people were injured in a Ukrainian missile and drone strike on oil facilities in Russia’s southern Krasnodar region, Russian officials said on Friday.
The Russian defence ministry said on the Telegram app that its air defence systems had destroyed five missiles and 29 drones which Ukraine had launched early on Friday.
The Ukrainian military said missiles fired by the Ukrainian navy had struck an oil terminal at the Russian port of Kavkaz in the Krasnodar region and that drones had struck another oil depot in the same region.
Krasnodar Governor Veniamin Kondratyev said on Telegram that falling drone debris had sparked a fire at an oil depot in the Temryuk district, damaging several tanks filled with fuel.
Separately, the Russian defence ministry said its forces had downed single drones over the Voronezh, Belgorod and Tambov regions overnight.
event_breakdown: Two people were injured in a Ukrainian missile and drone strike on oil facilities in the Russian city of Krasnodar on Friday, Russian officials said. A fire broke out at an oil depot when the missile debris sparked a fire at an oil depot in the Temryuk district. The falling drone debris also damaged several fuel-filled tanks.

title: Russia Lost 1 , 200 a Day in May , Highest Since War Began : Intel
message:
The assessment attributes the elevated casualty rate to Russia's brutal ongoing offensive, noting that Russia's ability to replenish its units is stretched thin due to its consistent losses.
According to Friday's intel from the UK Ministry of Defense, the average number of Russian personnel casualties was over 1,200 a day in May, the highest number reported since the war began.
The ministry also said the total number of killed or wounded Russian soldiers since the February 2022 invasion is likely at 500,000.
It's likely also the result of Russia rushing relatively inexperienced and untrained soldiers into battle, often in bloody head-on assaults.
But Russia's high casualties also prevents it from training more capable units and keeping a majority of its troops in battle long enough to gain experience.
event_breakdown:
Events:
1. Russia's casualty rate over 1,200 a day in May, highest number reported since the war began.
2. The total number of killed or wounded Russian soldiers since February is likely at 500,000.

title: Women were barred from combat during WWII . But they helped ensure the Allie D - Day success
message:
D-Day, took place on June 6, 1944, the invasion of the beaches at Normandy in France by Alied forces during World War II.
For British women who came of age during World War II, the answer to that question is often: quite a lot.
But behind the scenes were hundreds of thousands of military women who worked in crucial non-combat roles such as codebreakers, ship plotters, radar operators and cartographers.
Although technically barred from combat, more than 800 British women were killed in military service during the war.

title: Israeli Troops Push Into Central Rafah
message:
Israeli forces have pushed into central Rafah in south Gaza, targeting what they say is the last major redoubt of Hamas battalions.
In an update on more than two weeks of fierce fighting in Jabalia, the Israeli military said troops had completed their operation and withdrawn to prepare for other operations in Gaza.
It said Israeli troops killed hundreds of militants in close-quarter combat and seized large caches of weaponry and destroyed rocket launchers primed for use.
Jabalia has been battered by intense combat for weeks, underscoring Israel's difficulty in destroying Hamas units.
Hamas fighters demonstrated their continuing strength in Rafah last week, launching missiles at Israel's commercial hub Tel Aviv for the first time in months on Sunday.

title: Israeli military says combat in part of north Gaza is over
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelIsraeli forces have ended combat operations in the Jabalia area of north Gaza after destroying more than 10 kilometres of tunnels during days of intense fighting that included over 200 air strikes, the military said on Friday.At the south end of Gaza, Israeli forces pressing an offensive into Rafah found rocket launchers and other weapons as well as tunnel shafts built by Hamas in the city centre, the army said.
Tank-led Israeli troops aim to break up Hamas' fighting formations in the city on the border with Egypt.In an update on more than two weeks of intense fighting in Jabalia, the Israeli military said troops had completed their operation and withdrawn to prepare for other operations in Gaza.During the operation, troops recovered the bodies of seven of the 250 hostages Hamas-led militants abducted when they stormed over the border into Israel on Oct. 7 last year and killed around 1,200 people, according to Israeli tallies.Since then, over 36,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's air and land war in Gaza, its Hamas-run health ministry says, and much of the densely populated enclave lies in ruins.In Jabalia, a densely packed urban district populated by refugees from the 1948 war of Israel's founding and their descendants, Hamas turned the "civilian area into a fortified combat compound", the military statement said.It said Israeli troops killed hundreds of militants in close-quarter combat and seized large caches of weaponry and destroyed rocket launchers primed for use.Underground, Israel forces disabled a weapons-filled tunnel network extending over 10 km and killed Hamas' district battalion commander, it said.Israel has blamed what it calls Hamas' deliberate embedding of fighters in residential areas for the high civilian toll in the war.
Hamas has denied using civilians as cover for fighters.Jabalia has been battered by intense combat for weeks, underscoring Israel's difficulty in destroying Hamas units.There were weeks of heavy fighting in Jabalia in the early stages of the Israeli campaign and in January, the military said it had killed all the Hamas commanders and eliminated the combat formations of Gaza's ruling group in the area.Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's vow to eradicate Hamas as a fighting and political force has run up against the Islamist group's deep roots in Gaza's social fabric.U.S.
Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged Israel on Wednesday to come up with a post-war plan for Gaza, warning that without one, further military gains might not be durable, and lawlessness, chaos and a Hamas comeback could ensue.RAFAH FIGHTINGIsraeli tanks rumbled into the centre of Rafah on Tuesday as part of a series of probing operations around the area that has become one of the main focal points of the war in Gaza, now in its eighth month.The army said it had come across longer-range rockets as well as stocks of rocket-propelled grenades, explosives and ammunition as it continued "intelligence-based operational activities" in Rafah, which skirts Gaza's border with Egypt.Hamas fighters demonstrated their continuing strength in Rafah last week, launching missiles at Israel's commercial hub Tel Aviv for the first time in months on Sunday.Islamic Jihad, Hamas' smaller militant ally, said on Friday it fired a barrage of mortar bombs at a gathering of Israeli soldiers and vehicles penetrating the vicinity of Salah al-Din Gate on Rafah's southern fringes.
It gave no more details.Rafah, the only major city in Gaza yet to have been taken by Israeli forces, had been a refuge for more than one million Palestinians driven from their homes by fighting in other areas of the small coastal enclave, but most have now left after being told to evacuate ahead of the Israeli operation.Hundreds of thousands are now living in tents and other temporary shelters in a special evacuation zone in nearby Al-Mawasi, a sandy, palm tree-dotted district on the coast, as well as areas in central Gaza.Israel has signalled for weeks that it intended to mount an assault on the remaining Hamas battalions in Rafah, drawing international condemnation and warnings even from allies like the United States not to attack the city while it remained full of displaced people.The risks were underlined on Sunday when an Israeli airstrike targeting two Hamas commanders outside the city set off a blaze that killed at least 45 people sheltering in tents next to the compound hit by the jets.As the war has dragged on and Gaza's infrastructure has been widely demolished, malnutrition has spread among the 2.3 million population as aid deliveries have slowed to a trickle, and the United Nations has warned of incipient famine.

title: Innovation will keep Nigeria ahead of security threats – Tinubu
message:
President Bola Tinubu has expressed optimism that Nigeria will prevail against adversaries undermining its peace and security.
Tinubu, represented by the President of the Senate, Godswill Akpabio, gave the assurance while inaugurating the headquarters of the Defence Intelligence Agency, in Abuja, on Thursday.
He said his confidence was anchored on the unwavering commitment of members of the Armed Forces of Nigeria and the intelligence agencies, including the Department of State Security, the Nigerian Intelligence Agency, and the Defence Intelligence Agency.
“The entire nation is behind you and appreciates your sacrifices.”According to him, Nigeria is bedevilled by a myriad of security challenges across the six geopolitical zones of the entire nation.
In our bid to combat physical threats, we deploy the armed forces in almost all the states to assist the civil authorities.

title: S . African Soldier Killed , 13 Wounded Fighting DR Congo Rebels
message:
One South African soldier was killed and 13 more wounded in a battle with M23 rebels in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the army said FridayJohannesburg, (APP - UrduPoint / Pakistan Point News - 31st May, 2024) One South African soldier was killed and 13 more wounded in a battle with M23 rebels in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the army said Friday.
South African troops have been deployed in the DRC as part of a Southern African Development Community (SADC) force helping the government put down a rebellion.
According to a statement from South African Defence Headquarters, a "battle ensued between M23 and our forces" in which "13 members were injured and one was fatally wounded".
"All the injured members were evacuated to Goma Hospital and are recuperating.
The Congolese army has tried to repel the rebel group, which has almost entirely encircled Goma, the provincial capital, where hundreds of thousands of displaced people have sought shelter.
event_breakdown: South African army reports the death of one soldier and 13 other injuries in fighting with M23 rebels east of the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: NATO wraps up largest military exercise in decades
message:
A NATO flag flies in the wind during the "National Guardian 2024" exercise as part of the "Quadriga" series of Bundeswehr exercises at the Oberlausitz military training area.
Robert Michael/dpaThe NATO military alliance on Friday concluded a four-month military exercise called Steadfast Defender 2024, the largest live exercise it has conducted for decades.
"More than 90,000 forces, more than 50 ships, more than 80 aircraft flying hundreds of sorties, and more than 1,100 combat vehicles from all 32 NATO Allies were involved in the exercise," a NATO press release said.
The exercise “demonstrated the incredible strength of the trans-Atlantic bond between NATO allies in Europe and those in North America,” NATO's European commander, General Christopher G Cavoli, said in the press release.
“The highly complex military activities conducted over the course of this exercise have demonstrated that this alliance is capable and ready to conduct our core mission of collective defence,” Cavoli said.
location: Steadfast Defender 2024 exercise took place at multiple locations. The main location was the Oberlausitz

title: North Korea trash rains onto South Korea , balloon by balloon . Here what it means
message:

Experts say the balloon campaigning is meant to stoke a division in South Korea over its conservative government’s hard line policy on North Korea.

In 2020, North Korea blew up an empty, South Korean-built liaison office on its territory in protest of South Korean civilian leafletting campaigns.

For British women who came of age during World War II, the answer to that question is often: quite a lot.
But behind the scenes were hundreds of thousands of military women who worked in crucial non-combat roles such as codebreakers, ship plotters, radar operators and cartographers.
Although technically barred from combat, more than 800 British women were killed in military service during the war.
They include the uniforms of the Auxiliary Territorial Service, the Women’s Auxiliary Air Force and the Women’s Royal Naval Service.

title: Air Force unit resumes intel ops after Discord leak
message:
The Air National Guard unit once home to the airman who leaked hundreds of classified documents will resume its intelligence mission this week.
“The 102d Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Group will resume its intelligence mission in support of Distributed Ground Station-Massachusetts on 1 June 2024 following approval by the Commander of Air Combat Command,” Air Force spokesperson Ann Stefanek said in a statement.
“The recertification process was authorized after the completion of Secretary of the Air Force and Air Combat Command Inspector General reinspection of the 102d Intelligence Wing and after a new organizational structure was implemented to enhance oversight of ISRG operations.
Last year, the Air Force inspector general launched an investigation into the incident, the commander of the 102nd intelligence wing was relieved, and 15 other members of the Guard were disciplined.
The Pentagon has since said it’s cracking down on “need to know” violations and will improve how it monitors people who handle classified information.

title: Richmond : World War II vet who went missing accounted for
message:
RICHMOND — A Richmond man who was went missing in action in World War II and was presumed dead has been accounted for officially 80 years after his death.
The War Department issued a death certificate for Dec. 20, 1943.
Eight years later, the Department of Defense and American Battle Monuments Commission exhumed unknown remains gathered in 1946 by an Army division tasked with recovering the remains of missing American personnel in Europe.
His name already had been memorialized on the Wall of the Missing at the Cambridge American Cemetery in England, along with others who went missing during the war.
A rosette will be placed next to his name to indicate he’s been accounted for.

title: Barred from combat , women working as codebreakers , cartographers and coxswains helped D - Day succeed
message:
LONDON (AP) — What did you do in the war, Granny?
For British women who came of age during World War II, the answer to that question is often: quite a lot.
The history of D-Day is often told through the stories of the men who fought and died when the Allies stormed the beaches of northern France on June 6, 1944.
But behind the scenes were hundreds of thousands of military women who worked in crucial non-combat roles such as codebreakers, ship plotters, radar operators and cartographers.
Often overlooked, their contributions have come into sharper focus as the number of living D-Day veterans dwindles and the world prepares for the 80th anniversary of the landings.

Santiago Jacobo was found dead around 4:50 a.m. on Feb. 10 in the main parking lot of Pleasant Hill Park, located at 147 Gregory Lane.
Kristic said evidence showed the suspects planned, coordinated and carried out the attack on Jacobo after he finished his shift working as a custodian at Pleasant Hill Park.
“Our thoughts and condolences remain with the Jacobo family,” Kristic said in the news release.
Anyone with information related to the case can contact the police department’s investigations bureau at 925-288-4630.

title: Houthi Rebels Claim Strike on USS Eisenhower amid U . S .- UK Operations in Yemen
message:
Yemen’s Houthi rebels have claimed a missile attack on the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, a U.S. Navy aircraft carrier operating in the Red Sea.
The claim came after a series of coordinated U.S. and U.K. strikes against Houthi targets in Yemen, which reportedly resulted in multiple casualties.
On May 30 2024, the U.K. took part in a joint operation with U.S. forces to target Houthi military facilities in Yemen.
This operation took place in order to hinder the Houthi rebels’ capacity to attack international shipping in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.
The Houthi strikes on shipping are claimed to be in solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza and are seen as retaliatory measures against U.S.-led airstrikes.

The operation took place in order to hinder the Houthi rebels’ capacity to attack international shipping in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden. The Houthi strikes on shipping are claimed to be in solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza and are seen as retaliatory measures against U.S.-led airstrikes.

title: Woman Stabbed on Whittier Hiking Trail ; Suspect Apprehended
message:
A woman was stabbed on a Whittier hiking trail Friday but was expected to survive, and a suspect was quickly taken into custody.
According to the Whittier Police Department, officers responded at 12:30 p.m. to a report of a stabbing on the Greenway Trail near Calmada Avenue.
“The victim provided a description of the suspect, who was quickly apprehended by responding officers and detectives in the adjacent neighborhood.”The suspect was described only as a 35-year-old man whose name was not released.
Police said they will be maintaining “additional police resources in the area.”It was unclear what prompted the attack.
Anyone with additional information was asked to contact Whittier police at 562-567-9240.
location: Greenway Trail near Calmada Avenue in Whittier, California

title: Battered , empty Myanmar town shows price of victory against junta
message:
Gutted buildings, vacant windows and blocks bombed to rubble show the price paid by the western Myanmar town of Pauktaw for victory against the junta in the country's civil war.
Fighters from the Arakan Army (AA) ethnic minority armed group took control of the fishing port of 20,000 people in January, as the conflict sparked by the military's coup entered its fourth year.
When a military helicopter hovered over Pauktaw and began shooting into the town last November, many fled in panic.
"There was no chance for us to take a single thing from our house," one woman now living outside the town told AFP.
In April, the AA warned residents of the town, which is home to an India-backed deep sea port, to leave ahead of a "decisive" battle.
event_breakdown: Target event not relevant.

title: Steve Phillips Obituary
message:
PHILLIPS, JR., STEVE F., Colonel Steve Franklin Phillips, Jr., 86, passed away October 8, 2006.
In 1964 he was selected as the Battalion Commander of 1st Battalion, 2d Infantry of the 5th Infantry Division and began training his battalion for the eventual deployment to the Republic of Vietnam.
In September 1965, his battalion was sent to Vietnam and reflagged under the 1st Infantry Division where he remained the commander for 6 months and was then promoted to Colonel and designated as the 1st Brigade Commander, 1st Infantry Division.
He also was a member of the Society of the 1st Division; Worshipful Master of the Hancock Masonic Lodge No.
Steve is survived by his loving wife of 61 years, Frances Eileen Phillips; daughter, Myra Gene Keleher and her husband Dennis ; sons, Steve F. Phillips, III, and John W. Phillips; brother, David Phillips; sisters, Clovis Steele, and Marian Phillips; grandchildren, Shannon Keleher, Amanda Keleher, Steve F. Phillips, IV, and Luis-Andrés Phillips.
event_breakdown: Steve Franklin Phillips, Jr., passed away on October 8, 2006. In 1964, he was selected as the Battalion Commander of 1st Battalion, 2d Infantry of the 5th Infantry Division and began training his battalion for the eventual deployment to the Republic of Vietnam. title: UN says Gaza aid not reaching the population
message:
The humanitarian aid allowed into the Gaza Strip is not getting to civilians in need, the United Nations said Friday, urging Israel to fulfil its legal obligations.
"The aid that is getting in is not getting to the people, and that's a major problem," Jens Laerke, spokesman for the U.N. humanitarian agency OCHA, told a media briefing in Geneva.
"We continue to insist that Israeli authorities' obligation under the law to facilitate delivery of aid does not stop at the border," said Laerke.
Militants also took 252 hostages, 121 of whom remain in Gaza, including 37 the army says are dead.
Israel's retaliatory offensive has killed at least 36,224 people in Gaza, mostly civilians, according to the Hamas-run territory's health ministry.

title: Poland reports  long and tense night  during Russian attack on Ukraine
message:
Poland reports "long and tense night" during Russian attack on UkraineOperational Command of the Polish Armed Forces has said that its own and allied aircraft were scrambled on the night of 31 May-1 June in response to the threat of Russian missile attacks on Ukrainian territory.
"It was a long and tense night for the entire air defence system of Poland," Polish Army Operational Command noted.
The deployment of Polish and allied aircraft ended at 06:00 as the threat of missile strikes by Russian aircraft on Ukrainian territory lessened.
"The Polish army is continuously monitoring the situation on Ukrainian territory and is on constant combat alert to ensure the security of Polish airspace," they stated.
This is not the first time Poland has scrambled fighter jets in connection with Russia's missile strikes on the territory of Ukraine.
event_breakdown: Poland reports "long and tense night" during Russian attack on Ukraine; Polish jets were scrambled for air defence

message:
The attack, which occurred on the night of May 31, marks yet another lethal incident in the ongoing conflict.
His statement came after the State Emergencies Service of Ukraine reported at 7:34 a.m. EET that they had recovered the sixth casualty of the attack.
Overnight, a barrage of explosions shook Kharkiv, the nation's second-largest city, as Russia targeted the area with S-300/S-400 missile systems.
Authorities indicated that there might still be survivors trapped beneath the debris, according to updates from the Kharkiv Oblast Military Administration.

title: Houthis Claim Red Sea Attack on American Aircraft Carrier After US - UK Strikes
message:
Houthis Claim Red Sea Attack on American Aircraft Carrier After US-UK StrikesSputnik News20240531DOHA (Sputnik) - Yemen's Ansar Allah movement, also known as Houthis, has launched missile and UAV attacks on a US aircraft carrier in the Red Sea in response to the bombing of the country, Houthi political office member Hezam al-Asad told Sputnik on Friday.
Late on Thursday, US and UK military aircraft carried out 13 strikes on positions the Houthis in three provinces of Yemen after a series of attacks on US ships in the Red, Arabian and Mediterranean seas.
A source in Al Hudaydah authorities told Sputnik at least two people were killed and 10 others were injured in the strikes.
Houthi military spokesman Yahya Saree said on Friday that the US and the UK attack on the Red Sea province of Al Hudaydah killed 16 people and wounded 41 others, including civilians.

This attack comes after a series of attacks on US ships in the Red Sea, Arabian Sea, and the Mediterranean Sea. The source in Al Hudaydah authorities confirmed to Sputnik that two people were killed and 10 others were injured in the attack. Additionally, an unnamed source in the US Department of Defense confirmed that a US aircraft carrier shot down a Houthi-launched UAV in the Red Sea. title: Russian glide bomb strike on Myrnohrad injures at least 5
message:
Russian forces attacked the town of Myrnohrad in Donetsk Oblast with two glide bombs on the evening of May 31, injuring at least five people, the Donetsk Oblast Prosecutor's Office said on June 1.
The injured people received medical attention, the prosecutor's office said.
Myrnohrad, which is located some 70 kilometers (43 miles) from the Russian-occupied regional capital of Donetsk, is regularly targeted in Russian attacks.
A Russian strike on the city on March 13 killed two people and injured five more.
Three days before, a Russian missile attack on Myrnohrad injured 10 people.

title: Russia unleashes biggest missile attack in weeks
message:
Russia launched 53 missiles of various types and 47 attack drones, according to Ukrainian officials - ARTUR ABRAMIV/ZUMA/SHUTTERSTOCKRussia unleashed the largest missile and drone attack against Ukraine’s critical infrastructure in more than three weeks on Friday night, firing a combined 100 missiles and drones.
The barrage targeted energy sites across the country, Ukrainian officials said on Saturday, damaging two thermal power plants and injuring civilians.
“It was another extremely difficult night for the Ukrainian energy sector.
Ukraine’s energy minister German Galushchenko said Russia had targeted sites in five regions – Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Kirovograd, Ivano-Frankivsk and Zaporizhzhya – stretching from near the eastern frontlines to Ukraine’s west, which borders the EU.
“Russia’s main goal is to normalise terror, to exploit the lack of sufficient air defence and determination of Ukraine’s partners,” he said.
event_breakdown: Russia attacks critical energy infrastructure across Ukraine and damages two thermal power plants. The attacks took place in five regions across the country: Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Kirovograd, Ivano-Frankivsk and Zaporizhzhya.

title: At least 19 injured as Russia hits Ukraine power grid with fresh barrage
message:
KYIV, Ukraine — Russia pummeled Ukraine's energy infrastructure with a large-scale drone and missile attack Saturday, injuring at least 19 people, local officials said.
Injuries were reported by officials across the country, including in Ukraine's western Lviv region and the central Dnipropetrovsk region.
The strikes were part of a series of sustained attacks by Russia against Ukraine's power grid, which has been ongoing since March.
Meanwhile, Ukraine's Energy Minister, Herman Halushchenko, said in a statement on social media that energy infrastructure in the Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Kirovohrad and Ivano-Frankivsk regions had also been targeted.
Damage to Ukraine's energy infrastructure in recent weeks has forced leaders of the war-ravaged country to institute nationwide rolling blackouts.
event_breakdown: Russia pummeled Ukraine's energy infrastructure with a large-scale drone and missile attack Saturday, injuring at least 19 people, local officials said.

Source: Ukraine’s Air Force on TelegramDetails: The Russians fired a total of 53 different types of missiles and 47 assault UAVs.
- 35 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95 MS strategic aviation aircraft (launch area in Saratov Oblast and airspace over the Caspian Sea, Russian Federation);- four Iskander-M ballistic missiles (launched from Crimea);- one Iskander-K cruise missile (launched from Crimea);- ten Kalibr cruise missiles (launched from the north-eastern part of the Black Sea).
- three Kh-59/Kh-69 guided air missiles (launched from the airspace of the temporarily-occupied territory of Zaporizhzhia Oblast);- 47 Shahed-131/136 assault UAVs (launched from Primorsko-Akhtarsk launch location, Russian Federation).
As a result of the anti-aircraft combat, anti-aircraft missile units, fighter aircraft, electronic warfare units of the Air Force and mobile fire groups of the Ukrainian Defence Forces shot down:- 30 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles,- four Kalibr cruise missiles,- one Iskander-K cruise missile;- 46 Shahed-131/136 assault UAVs.

title: Emergency services rushed to Devizes after  stabbing
message:
Wiltshire Police officers were called to an address in Rendells Court in Devizes at around 3.30pm on Friday, May 31, after reports that a man had been stabbed.
Land and air ambulances are also believed to have attended the scene of the knife attack, and a man in his 30s was rushed to Great Western Hospital.
A separate man also in his 30s was arrested on Saturday morning in connection to the alleged stabbing and he is being held in custody in Gloucestershire while enquiries are carried out.
The identity of the suspect has not yet been confirmed, but Wiltshire Police and the South Western Ambulance Service have been contacted for more information regarding the incident.
Anyone with information about these events should contact Wiltshire Police by calling 101.

title: Pentagon chief extends deployment of aircraft carrier , ships in the Red Sea as Houthi attacks go on
message:
Pentagon chief extends deployment of aircraft carrier, ships in the Red Sea as Houthi attacks go onWASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. Navy aircraft carrier strike group that for months has launched crucial strikes against Houthi rebels in Yemen to protect military and commercial ships in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden will remain in the region for at least another month, according to U.S. officials.
The other ships in the strike group are the USS Philippine Sea, a cruiser, and two destroyers, the USS Gravely and the USS Mason.
The Eisenhower and its strike group have been involved in routine operations against the Houthis all year.
And other ships in the strike group also launched missiles as part of the operation.
In all, the strike group has gone after about 430 either pre-planned or dynamic targets in its mission to defend U.S., coalition and merchant ships.

title: Two Killed , Five Injured In Israeli Airstrikes On S . Lebanon
message:
(MENAFN- Nam News Network) BEIRUT, Jun 1 (NNN-NNA) – A Hezbollah member and one civilian were killed, and five others wounded last night, in Israeli on southern Lebanon, according to Lebanese military sources.
The sources, who spoke anonymously, said, one Hezbollah member was killed and another wounded, in an Israeli attack in the town of Ain Qana, while another Israeli raid, in the town of Adloun, in the Sidon district, killed a woman and wounded four other civilians.
The sources added that, Israeli drones and warplanes carried out 10 raids on multiple areas, within the border region and deep in southern Lebanon, reaching the outskirts of Sidon and Iqlim al-Tuffah cities.
Tensions along the Lebanon-Israel border escalated on Oct 8, last year, following a barrage of rockets launched by the Lebanese armed group, Hezbollah, towards Israel, in solidarity with Hamas.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery towards southeastern Lebanon.– NNN-NNA

title: IDF hits Hamas , Al - Noor terror groups in Gaza Strip .
message:
Amid continued operations throughout the Gaza Strip, the IDF confirmed on Saturday that it struck a structure belonging to the Al-Noor organization, which supports Hamas, in the area of Daraj Tuffah in the Gaza Strip.
According to the IDF, this organization is classified as a terrorist organization based on funds that it transfers to Hamas.
Additionally, the IDF has continued the precise, intelligence-based targeted operations in areas of Rafah.
IDF troops have located numerous weapons in the area, including underground tunnel shafts, ready-to-fire rockets, explosive devices, AK-47 rifles, and other military equipment.
IDF soldiers operate in the Gaza Strip, June 1, 2024.

title: Israel confirms its forces are in central Rafah , defying international condemnation of operation in southern Gazan city
message:
CNNBy Tamar Michaelis and Rob Picheta, CNN(CNN) — The Israeli military is in central Rafah, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed in a statement Friday, despite international concern and anger over its military operation in Gaza’s southernmost city.
The IDF statement confirms what eyewitnesses told CNN earlier this week, when tanks were spotted in central Rafah for the first time since it entered the city earlier this month.
“IDF troops in central Rafah located Hamas rocket launchers, terror tunnel shafts, and weapons.
The troops also dismantled a Hamas weapons storage facility in the area,” the IDF said in the statement.
Over the weekend, Israel launched an airstrike on a displacement camp in the city, killing dozens and creating global outrage.
event_breakdown: IDF troops in central Rafah located Hamas rocket launchers, terror tunnel shafts, and weapons. The troops also dismantled a Hamas weapons storage facility in the area.

title: Russia electronic attacks partially disrupt Starlink in Ukraine
message:
Russia's electronic warfare influence “does not completely interrupt the operation of Starlink, but it does cause some discomfort” on the front, Serhiy Beskrestnov, a military expert in communications, electronic reconnaissance and warfare, call sign "Flash," said ina recent interview with Radio NV.
This situation aligns with a May 24 New York Times report detailing Starlink connectivity disruptions in Ukraine's Kharkiv Oblast, which coincided with a new Russian offensive.
Kari A. Bingen, a former Pentagon official and electronic warfare expert, suggested that Russia could be jamming Starlink by using powerful radio frequencies to overwhelm communication channels.
Additionally, experts believe Russia may be employing specialized electronic weapons on drones to disrupt GPS signals utilized by Starlink.

message:

message:
NATO wraps up its largest exercise since the Cold WarNATO - North Atlantic Treaty Organisation31 May.
2024NATO's largest exercise in decades, Steadfast Defender 2024, concluded on Friday (31 May 2024).
During the four-month exercise, Allies demonstrated how they can deploy forces from both sides of the Atlantic rapidly across the Alliance.
Approximately 90,000 troops, over 80 aircraft, 50 ships and 1,100 combat vehicles took part in the exercise.

title: French nurse dubbed  Angel of Dien Bien Phu  dies aged 99
message:
French nurse dubbed ‘Angel of Dien Bien Phu’ dies aged 99Genevieve de Galard, the "Angel of Dien Bien Phu," died at 99, hailed for her "exemplary devotion" by French President Macron.
Genevieve de Galard, a nurse dubbed the “Angel of Dien Bien Phu” for treating wounded during a defining 1954 battle in then French Indochina, has died aged 99, with President Emmanuel Macron on Friday hailing her “exemplary devotion”.
One of the evacuation planes she travelled in was destroyed by gunfire when she was about to leave Dien Bien Phu.
The English translation of her memoir, The Angel of Dien Bien Phu, was published in 2010.
Defence Minister Sebastien Lecornu represented Paris at commemorations marking the 70th anniversary of Dien Bien Phu in May.

Current events of security that are not reported in the text:
Dien Bien Phu, Genevieve de Galard

title: Israel completes combat operations in part of north Gaza , military says
message:
In a statement on more than two weeks of fierce fighting in Jabalia, the Israeli military said troops had completed their operation and withdrawn to prepare for other operations in Gaza.
In Jabalia, a crowded urban district populated by refugees from the 1948 war of Israel's founding and their descendants, Hamas turned the "civilian area into a fortified combat compound", the Israeli military statement said.
It said Israeli troops killed hundreds of fighters in close-quarter combat and seized large caches of weaponry and destroyed rocket launchers primed for use.
Underground, Israel forces disabled a weapons-filled tunnel network extending over 10 km and killed Hamas' district battalion commander, it said.
Israel has blamed what it calls Hamas' deliberate embedding of fighters in residential areas for the high civilian toll in the war.
event_breakdown: Israeli troops withdraw from operation in Jabalia

title: Yemen Houthis sentence 44 to death on charges of collaboration with a Saudi - led coalition | World News
message:
A court run by Yemen's Houthi rebels on Saturday sentenced 44 people to death, including a businessman working with aid groups, on spying charges, a defense lawyer said.
Sixteen were sentenced to death in absentia, while 28 were brought before the Specialized Criminal Court in the capital Sanaa, Sabra said.
Thousands have been imprisoned by the Houthis during Yemen’s civil war.
Courts in Sanaa and other Houthi-held areas in Yemen used to give harsh sentences to those accused of collaborating with the Saudi-led coalition.
A Saudi-led coalition including the United Arab Emirates intervened in 2015 to try to restore the internationally recognized government.

title: Cargo ship struck by Houthi missiles was carrying grain to Iran
message:
The Laax, a Greek-owned, Marshall Islands-flagged bulk carrier, was attacked by Houthis in response to the war in GazaA cargo ship that was struck by five missiles launched by Yemen’s Houthis was carrying grain destined for Iran, the group’s main backers, it has emerged.
Images released by the French navy appeared to show damage at the waterline of the vessel, as well as on its deck.
The Houthis used drones and missiles in the attack on the Laax, according to the French navy’s statement.
It was not clear if the newly supplied Ghadr missiles were part of the barrage.
French naval forces based in the UAE agreed that the cargo ship was probably bound for Iran.

title: Livestream footage shows man being shot after stabbing six people at anti - Islam event in Germany Mannheim
message:
A man was shot by police after going on a stabbing rampage at a right-wing event in the German city of Mannheim on Friday.
Footage from a livestream on YouTube shows a man rampantly attacking six people, including a police officer, with a knife in the city’s Marktplatz square.
The attack took place at an event of the Citizens’ Movement Pax Europa where anti-Islam speaker Michael Stürzenberger was readying to speak.
Footage showed the man stabbing six people at a rally in Mannheim Germany.

title: At Least 19 Injured as Russia Hits Ukraine Power Grid with Fresh Barrage
message:
Russia pummeled Ukraine's energy infrastructure with a large-scale drone and missile attack Saturday, injuring at least 19 people, local officials said.
Injuries were reported by officials across the country, including in Ukraine's western Lviv region and the central Dnipropetrovsk region.
The strikes were part of a series of sustained attacks by Russia against Ukraine's power grid, which has been ongoing since March.
Meanwhile, Ukraine's Energy Minister, Herman Halushchenko, said in a statement on social media that energy infrastructure in the Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Kirovohrad, and Ivano-Frankivsk regions had also been targeted.
Damage to Ukraine's energy infrastructure in recent weeks has forced leaders of the war-ravaged country to institute nationwide rolling blackouts.

title: Türkiye only country to strongly react against Israeli atrocities
message:
President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan said Türkiye is the only country displaying a strong reaction against Israel's ongoing massacres in Gaza and took concrete measures against it.
Türkiye stopped commercial transactions with Israel, first in 54 items and then in all items, he added.
Noting that Türkiye "stands tall with the heroic people of Palestine” who defend their homeland, he said his country does not hesitate to shout out the Palestinian resistance.
Around 36,400 Palestinians have since been killed in Gaza, the vast majority being women and children, and over 82,000 others injured, according to local health authorities.
Nearly eight months into the Israeli war, vast swathes of Gaza lay in ruins amid a crippling blockade of food, clean water, and medicine.

title: Afghan - born man remanded in custody over Mannheim knife attack
message:
A 25-year-old man born in Afghanistan has been remanded in custody by a German court on suspicion of attempted murder in connection with a knife attack at an event organised by a group opposing “political Islam”.
The six victims included a police officer who remains in hospital with life-threatening injuries after he was stabbed while trying to intervene, police and prosecutors said.
Officials offered no information regarding the motive for the attack on Friday on the central square in Mannheim.
A statement from police and prosecutors said that the suspect had lived in Germany since 2014, was married and has two children.
The 25-year-old man has been released from hospital while the others are still being treated.
event_breakdown:
Location: Mannheim, Germany
Event: A man born in Afghanistan has been remanded in custody by a German court on suspicion of attempted murder in connection with a knife attack at an event organised by a group opposing "political Islam". The victims were six, including a police officer who remains in hospital with life-threatening injuries. The motive of the attack remains unclear. Authorities in Germany say the man has lived in the country since 2014, is married and has two children.

title: Lebanon complains to UN over Israeli strike that wounded schoolchildren
message:
Lebanon has submitted a complaint to the U.N. Security Council over an Israeli drone strike this month on a car that also damaged a nearby minibus wounding several schoolchildren, the Foreign Ministry said.
A source close to Hezbollah said one of the group's fighters was killed in that strike.
The attack was "a violation of international humanitarian law," the Foreign Ministry said, urging the Security Council to "condemn Israel's direct, deliberate and repeated targeting of civilians."
event_breakdown: Lebanon files complaint to U.N. Security Council over Israeli drone strike in Beirut.
